text.p: Canadian Bond Rating Service said on Friday it reinstated credit ratings for the outstanding debt securities of Le Groupe Videotron Ltee and Videotron Ltee, with an outlook revised to positive from stable.

CBRS said Le Groupe Videotron's 10.625 percent senior unsecured notes, due 2005, were rated at B+, while Videotron's commercial paper was rated at A-2, 12 percent senior secured debentures, series A, maturing 2000 at B++(high) and 10.25 percent senior subordinated notes maturing 2002 at B+(high).
The bond rating service had maintained Videotron and its units on CBRS's credit watch list since November 20, 1995 as the company undertook a series of significant transactions.

CBRS said the positive outlook reflected the company's substantially de-levered capital structure, higher levels of cash flow, increasingly focused strategy, unique operating environment in the Quebec market, reduced capital expenditure requirements and its industry leading operational experience in a number of broadband initiatives and enhanced services such as bi-directional interactivity and cable telephony.
